meanings.definition: To sing louder or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the competition, Sarah tried to outsing her rival with a powerful voice.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outsing the other choir members during performances.
meanings.sent3: The birds in the park seemed to have a contest to see who could outsing the others.
meanings.sent4: His voice could outsing even the most talented singers in the music industry.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's enthusiasm to outsing everyone in the school talent show was admirable.

meanings.sent1: In the singing competition, she aimed to outsing her opponents with her beautiful voice.
meanings.sent2: He always manages to outsing his friends when they have karaoke nights.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outsing the dog in a playful musical battle.
meanings.sent4: Her voice could outsing the birds in the garden, captivating everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The opera singer's ability to outsing her colleagues was truly remarkable.
